docs.snippet: Last evening the New-York Chess Club made their long-talked of presentation of the gold and silver chess-men, pearl inlaid board, and the American watch to PAUL MORPHY the Chess Champion of the world.

headline.main: THE CHESS CHAMPION.; Presentation to Paul Murphy by the New-York Chess Club. MR. MORTHYS REPLIES. Speeches by John Van Buren, Esq., W. J. A. Fulier, Esq., and Col. Mead.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last evening the New-York Chess Club made their long-talked of presentation of the gold and silver chess-men, pearl inlaid board, and the American watch to PAUL MORPHY the Chess Champion of the world.

docs.snippet: STREET CLEANING.--The street cleaning under Mayor TIEMANN starts well. We hope there will be no fainting by the way, for there is no time to spare. Stirring up such immense accumulations of dirt, hoeing out gutters that have been for months choked...
docs.lead_paragraph: STREET CLEANING.--The street cleaning under Mayor TIEMANN starts well. We hope there will be no fainting by the way, for there is no time to spare. Stirring up such immense accumulations of dirt, hoeing out gutters that have been for months choked up, is a dangerous business for June.

docs.snippet: THE COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Commissioners of Health held a private meeting at the Mayor's office yesterday. Reports were received from the captains of 17 police precincts, detailing the general condition of the streets.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--The Commissioners of Health held a private meeting at the Mayor's office yesterday. Reports were received from the captains of 17 police precincts, detailing the general condition of the streets.

docs.snippet: The ladies' shoemakers in Philadelphia met in convention a night or two ago, and adopted the following pungent resolution, among others: "That we recommend the unmarried men of the trade to accept the invitation of God of Nature gives them, to seek...
docs.lead_paragraph: The ladies' shoemakers in Philadelphia met in convention a night or two ago, and adopted the following pungent resolution, among others: "That we recommend the unmarried men of the trade to accept the invitation of God of Nature gives them, to seek employment in the invigorating and health-giving atmosphere of he country, thereby giving those who have to stay in a crowded city by necessity, the ability to maintain intact the bill of wages."

docs.snippet: Mr. MICHAEL PHELAN publishes in Porter's Spirit a rejoinder to the letter of JOHN SIEREITER concerning the new Billiard challenge, He take direct issue with SIEREITER on technical points; states that the cloth and balls used in the Detroit match were...

headline.main: SPORTING NEWS.; Billiards-Pheian's Rejoinder to Seereiter--The British Championship--Pigeon-Sheeting, &c..

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MICHAEL PHELAN publishes in Porter's Spirit a rejoinder to the letter of JOHN SIEREITER concerning the new Billiard challenge, He take direct issue with SIEREITER on technical points; states that the cloth and balls used in the Detroit match were not chosen without SIEREITER'S knowledge, but that the latter selected the balls and had played one cloth precisely like that on which the match was contested.

headline.main: The Motives of our Law Makers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. WETMORE has twice reported to the Sanitary Committee the manner in which its Health Bill was defeated in the late Assembly. One report was verbal, and the other written; both have been duly laid before our readers. On both occasions Gen. WETMORE charged that defeat to the account of Mr. C. S. docs.snippet: The most deplorable accounts reach us daily of the sutlerings among the disappointed gold-seekers in Kansas. A correspondent of the St. Louis Democrat, writhing from Deaver City on the 9th inst., asserts that many of the emigrants were dying of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The most deplorable accounts reach us daily of the sutlerings among the disappointed gold-seekers in Kansas. A correspondent of the St. Louis Democrat, writhing from Deaver City on the 9th inst., asserts that many of the emigrants were dying of starvation, and that in some instances the dead bodies of these who had perished were devoured by surviving companions.

docs.snippet: As a long pcace breeds contempt for forts and ships-of-war, so a long exemption from epidemics of imported origin brings quarantine establishments into disgrace. Hence it may be expected, without any reference to the actual power of quarantine to...
docs.lead_paragraph: As a long pcace breeds contempt for forts and ships-of-war, so a long exemption from epidemics of imported origin brings quarantine establishments into disgrace. Hence it may be expected, without any reference to the actual power of quarantine to avert certain diseases, if Providence spares us another Summer from the ravages of yellow fever,
